revised_title: The Constitution of Blood and Nutrition of Muscular Tissue
tldr: The author investigates the composition of blood and the nutrition of muscular tissue. They discover that blood is a colloid fluid containing diffusible and undiffusible substances. The study also reveals that muscular tissue is made up of three classes of substances, with the third class containing crystalloid, diffusible elements. The author concludes that vegetable food can transform phosphoric anhydride and potash from crystalloid to colloid state, which becomes part of the blood's normal constituents and contributes to the nutrition of flesh.
